Question_1.Context: Microneedle electrodes are used to monitor bioelectrical signals and can penetrate the skin, offering advantages over surface electrodes.
Question_1.Question: What is the main advantage of microneedle electrodes (ME) compared to surface electrodes (SE)?
Question_1.A: ME can monitor a wider range of signals.
Question_1.B: ME can penetrate the skin to improve recording quality.
Question_1.C: ME are less expensive to produce.
Question_1.D: ME do not require any form of skin preparation.
Question_1.Source: The microneedle electrode (ME) is an invasive dry electrode penetrating stratum corneum of the skin with a needle, so recording quality is improved compared with SE.

Question_2.Context: In the context of microneedle fabrication, various materials can be used, each with their own advantages and limitations.
Question_2.Question: Which material is preferred for fabricating microneedles due to its biocompatibility and flexibility?
Question_2.Source: Accordingly, biocompatible and flexible materials such as polymer are preferred to fabricate microneedle.

Question_3.Context: The shape and sharpness of microneedles are crucial for their performance, particularly in terms of penetration capability and minimizing tissue damage.
Question_3.Question: What aspect of a microneedle's shape is directly relevant to its penetration capability and secure implantation?
Question_3.B: The width of the microneedle base
Question_3.D: The curvature of the microneedle shaft
Question_3.Source: The second one is that it is difficult to control the shape of microneedles including needle bevel which is directly relevant to penetration capability, secure after implantation, and tissue damage.

Question_4.Context: 3D printing technology has been applied to the fabrication of microneedles, offering the ability to control their shape.
Question_4.Question: Which 3D printing method uses a laser to harden a photocurable resin layer by layer?
Question_4.Source: In this study, the SLA printing method was used to fabricate a 3D printed microneedle mold. SLA printing uses a laser to harden a photocurable resin.

Question_5.Context: The resolution of 3D printed objects is an important factor, especially when fabricating delicate and small objects like microneedles.
Question_5.Question: What limits the resolution of the output in SLA 3D printing?
Question_5.A: The precision of the resin tank
Question_5.C: The speed of the printing process
Question_5.D: The type of photocurable resin used
Question_5.Source: However, there is a limit to the resolution because the resolution of the output is determined by the size of the laser.

Question_6.Context: Polyimide is a material used in the fabrication of microneedles due to its desirable properties.
Question_6.Question: What is one of the key advantages of using polyimide (PI) for microneedle fabrication?
Question_6.Source: Polyimide (PI) has excellent biocompatibility and excellent adhesion to metals.

Question_7.Context: Aspect ratio is a significant parameter in the design of microneedles as it affects their performance.
Question_7.Question: What is the aspect ratio of commonly used microneedles?
Question_7.Source: The aspect ratio of commonly used microneedles is 2:1 or higher.

Question_8.Context: The penetration capability of microneedles can be tested using materials that mimic human skin.
Question_8.Question: Which material is often used for penetration testing of microneedles due to its similarity to human skin?
Question_8.Source: Furthermore, the insertion test of the fabricated PI microneedle was conducted in porcine skin that has similar characteristics to human skin.

Question_9.Context: The height implementation rate is a measure of how well the actual height of a fabricated microneedle matches the designed height.
Question_9.Question: What happens to the height implementation rate of a polyimide microneedle as the print height increases?
Question_9.Source: As the height was increased, the aspect ratio was also increased, and showed the highest value when the height was 1000 μm.

Question_10.Context: The bevel angle of a microneedle is an important factor that influences its ability to penetrate the skin.
Question_10.Question: What was the sharpest bevel angle achieved for a polyimide microneedle using a novel 3D printing fabrication process?
Question_10.Source: The sharpest bevel angle was 54.5° that was fabricated by the angle (α) at 40°.
